programme.desc: שידור חוזר: ליגה איטלקית 2025/26, מחזור 27: קומו מארחת את לצ'ה עם עמרי גנדלמן.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
Back to the Future Part III
Back to the Future Part II
Back to the Future Part III
Two Mules for Sister Sara
programme.desc: A grizzled drifter rescues a nun from a gang of rapists and gets roped into escorting her across the Mexican desert. He gradually realises there is more to his new companion than meets the eye - and she may be hiding a surprising secret. Don Siegel's Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Shirley MacLaine, Manolo Fabregas, Alberto Morin and John Kelly.(n)

programme.title: Quartet
programme.desc: Three former opera singers prepare for their annual concert to mark Verdi's birthday and raise funds for their retirement home. However, this year, a famous diva has joined the group, and her history with the others threatens the performance. Comedy drama, directed by Dustin Hoffman and starring Maggie Smith, Billy Connolly, Tom Courtenay, Pauline Collins and Michael Gambon.(n)

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: A retired army colonel has raised his three sons alone on their remote Montana ranch. But the all-male household is thrown into turmoil when the youngest son brings home his beautiful fiancee, causing jealousy and tensions that culminate in tragedy. Edward Zwick's period drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Brad Pitt, Aidan Quinn, Julia Ormond and Henry Thomas.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.(n)

programme.title: Darkest Hour
programme.desc: May 1940. As the Nazis advance against Britain's European allies, newly elected prime minister Winston Churchill must decide whether to leave neighbouring countries to their fate, by striking a peace deal with Hitler, or fight on against terrifying odds for the greater good. Double Oscar and Bafta-winning period drama, starring Gary Oldman, Lily James and Kristin Scott Thomas.(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.(n)

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: A woman supports her daughter despite their differences over three tumultuous decades. The indomitable matriarch disapproves of her daughter's marriage and finds grandmotherhood hard to get used to, but is fiercely protective of her family when tragedy strikes. Oscar-winning drama, starring Shirley MacLaine, Debra Winger, Jack Nicholson, Danny DeVito and Jeff Daniels.(n)

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: The Cut
programme.desc: A retired boxer returns to the ring for one last shot at the title, but must embark on an illegal weight cut programme first. Sports thriller, starring Orlando Bloom, Caitriona Balfe and John Turturro.(n)

programme.title: Joker: Folie a Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck meets the love of his life, Harleen 'Lee' Quinzel, while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Musical thriller, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Lady Gaga and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.(n)

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: A woman supports her daughter despite their differences over three tumultuous decades. The indomitable matriarch disapproves of her daughter's marriage and finds grandmotherhood hard to get used to, but is fiercely protective of her family when tragedy strikes. Oscar-winning drama, starring Shirley MacLaine, Debra Winger, Jack Nicholson, Danny DeVito and Jeff Daniels.(n)

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: The Cut
programme.desc: A retired boxer returns to the ring for one last shot at the title, but must embark on an illegal weight cut programme first. Sports thriller, starring Orlando Bloom, Caitriona Balfe and John Turturro.(n)

programme.title: Cookster: The Darkest Days
programme.desc: Misunderstood by his family, a dyslexic teen becomes a drug dealer, descending into addiction and debt while a dangerous rival threatens his world and his relationship. Drama, starring Craige Middleburg and Nick Moran.(n)

programme.title: Joker: Folie a Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck meets the love of his life, Harleen 'Lee' Quinzel, while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Musical thriller, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Lady Gaga and Brendan Gleeson.(n)

programme.title: The Post
programme.desc: In 1971, an American military analyst uncovers the depths of the US government's deceptions about the futility of the Vietnam War, and takes action by copying top-secret documents that would become the Pentagon Papers. Washington Post owner Kay Graham and her editor Ben Bradlee discover The New York Times is preparing an explosive expose on those papers and, determined to compete, set out to publish them first. Steven Spielberg's fact-based drama, starring Meryl Streep, Tom Hanks, Sarah Paulson and Bob Odenkirk.(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: An idealistic sports agent produces a mission statement at work promising to treat clients fairly. Unfortunately, it costs him his job. Forced to set up an agency on his own, the only people prepared to stand by him are a lovelorn staff accountant and a footballer. Cameron Crowe's romantic comedy drama, with Tom Cruise, Renee Zellweger, Kelly Preston, Jonathan Lipnicki, and Cuba Gooding Jr, who won an Oscar for his performance.(n)

programme.title: Anora
programme.desc: A sex worker marries the son of an oligarch, but his family in Russia try to get the marriage annulled. Writer/director Sean Baker's Oscar-winning romantic comedy, starring Mikey Madison, Paul Weissman and Lindsey Normington.

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: An idealistic sports agent produces a mission statement at work promising to treat clients fairly. Unfortunately, it costs him his job. Forced to set up an agency on his own, the only people prepared to stand by him are a lovelorn staff accountant and a footballer. Cameron Crowe's romantic comedy drama, with Tom Cruise, Renee Zellweger, Kelly Preston, Jonathan Lipnicki, and Cuba Gooding Jr, who won an Oscar for his performance.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: A retired army colonel has raised his three sons alone on their remote Montana ranch. But the all-male household is thrown into turmoil when the youngest son brings home his beautiful fiancee, causing jealousy and tensions that culminate in tragedy. Edward Zwick's period drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Brad Pitt, Aidan Quinn, Julia Ormond and Henry Thomas.

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. Romantic comedy adapted from Nick Hornby's novel, starring Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, Nicholas Hoult and Rachel Weisz.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: Following the assassination of her husband, President John F Kennedy, Jacqueline Kennedy battles with grief and trauma to regain her faith, console her children, and define JFK's legacy. Director Pablo Larrain's Bafta-winning drama, starring Natalie Portman, Peter Sarsgaard and Greta Gerwig. Mica Levi provided the Oscar-nominated score.

programme.title: The Post
programme.desc: In 1971, an American military analyst uncovers the depths of the US government's deceptions about the futility of the Vietnam War, and takes action by copying top-secret documents that would become the Pentagon Papers. Washington Post owner Kay Graham and her editor Ben Bradlee discover The New York Times is preparing an explosive expose on those papers and, determined to compete, set out to publish them first. Steven Spielberg's fact-based drama, starring Meryl Streep, Tom Hanks, Sarah Paulson and Bob Odenkirk.

programme.title: Molly's Game
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game for a decade before being arrested in the middle of the night by FBI agents wielding automatic weapons. Her players included Hollywood royalty, sports stars, business titans and finally - unbeknownst to her - the Russian Mob. Directed by The West Wing creator Aaron Sorkin, and starring Jessica Chastain, Idris Elba and Kevin Costner.

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: An idle womaniser pretends to be a father to meet women in a single mothers' group - but he starts to change his selfish ways when a lonely youngster with a depressed mum becomes emotionally attached to him. Romantic comedy adapted from Nick Hornby's novel, starring Hugh Grant, Toni Collette, Nicholas Hoult and Rachel Weisz.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: When a couple flee Europe in 1947, their new lives in the US are changed by a strange client. Director Brady Corbet's drama, starring Adrien Brody, Felicity Jones, Guy Pearce and Joe Alwyn.

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Risky Romance
programme.desc: From killers and zombies to forbidden love and dangerous desires, The Cinema List explores romances where passion courts danger and love is always worth the risk.

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: A Rastafarian garage mechanic in a tough London neighbourhood heads up a mobile DJ crew and prepares to compete in a sound-systems competition. However, he has to contend with racism, violence and crime, and his life begins to unravel as he loses his job, is harassed by the police under stop-and-search laws and has his equipment destroyed by angry neighbours. Drama, with Brinsley Forde and Karl Howman.

programme.title: The Cut
programme.desc: A retired boxer returns to the ring for one last shot at the title, but must embark on an illegal weight cut programme first. Sports thriller, starring Orlando Bloom, Caitriona Balfe and John Turturro.

programme.title: The Good Half
programme.desc: Returning home for his mother's funeral, Renn Wheeland forges new relationships and heals old ones as he faces his grief. Drama, starring Nick Jonas, David Arquette and Brittany Snow.

programme.title: Molly's Game
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about Molly Bloom, an Olympic-class skier who ran the world's most exclusive high-stakes poker game for a decade before being arrested in the middle of the night by FBI agents wielding automatic weapons. Her players included Hollywood royalty, sports stars, business titans and finally - unbeknownst to her - the Russian Mob. Directed by The West Wing creator Aaron Sorkin, and starring Jessica Chastain, Idris Elba and Kevin Costner.

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.

programme.title: Lost in Translation
programme.desc: A lonely and past-his-prime American actor travels to Japan to film a commercial. During a depressing night in the hotel bar, he meets a spirited younger woman and the pair strike up a close friendship, exploring Tokyo and helping each other face the mundanities of everyday life. Sofia Coppola's comedy drama, starring Bill Murray, Scarlett Johansson and Giovanni Ribisi.

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: A Rastafarian garage mechanic in a tough London neighbourhood heads up a mobile DJ crew and prepares to compete in a sound-systems competition. However, he has to contend with racism, violence and crime, and his life begins to unravel as he loses his job, is harassed by the police under stop-and-search laws and has his equipment destroyed by angry neighbours. Drama, with Brinsley Forde and Karl Howman.

programme.title: The Cut
programme.desc: A retired boxer returns to the ring for one last shot at the title, but must embark on an illegal weight cut programme first. Sports thriller, starring Orlando Bloom, Caitriona Balfe and John Turturro.

programme.title: Empire of the Sun
programme.desc: An English boy living in Shanghai is separated from his parents during the Japanese invasion and forced to live on the streets. The youngster is befriended by an American sailor, who helps the boy adapt to life without his family, before the pair are eventually captured and subjected to the terrors of internment. Steven Spielberg's Second World War drama based on JG Ballard's semi-autobiographical novel, starring Christian Bale, John Malkovich and Nigel Havers.

programme.title: An Officer and a Gentleman
programme.desc: A Navy recruit undergoing officer training has an uneasy romance with a factory worker. He also attracts the attention of a tough, uncompromising sergeant, who sees his potential and is determined to push him to the limit. Romantic drama, starring Richard Gere, Debra Winger, Louis Gossett Jr, Robert Loggia, David Keith and David Caruso.

programme.title: Two Mules for Sister Sara
programme.desc: A grizzled drifter rescues a nun from a gang of rapists and gets roped into escorting her across the Mexican desert. He gradually realises there is more to his new companion than meets the eye - and she may be hiding a surprising secret. Don Siegel's Western, starring Clint Eastwood, Shirley MacLaine, Manolo Fabregas, Alberto Morin and John Kelly.

programme.title: The Damned United
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton \u0026 Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Following a gig, fading music star Jackson Maine happens upon Ally, a nightclub singer-songwriter. Their instant chemistry leads to a tempestuous romance as he helps her on the road to stardom. However, Jackson's alcoholism has explosive repercussions as her career blossoms. Oscar-winning drama, starring Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper, who also directed, and Sam Elliott.

programme.title: Burning an Illusion
programme.desc: A black woman living in West London hopes to marry her boyfriend, but finds her life thrown into upheaval when he loses his job and is subsequently arrested after getting into a fight. The experience makes her reassess her priorities, and she decides to reconnect with her African heritage. Drama, starring Cassie McFarlane and Victor Romero Evans.

programme.title: An Officer and a Gentleman
programme.desc: A Navy recruit undergoing officer training has an uneasy romance with a factory worker. He also attracts the attention of a tough, uncompromising sergeant, who sees his potential and is determined to push him to the limit. Romantic drama, starring Richard Gere, Debra Winger, Louis Gossett Jr, Robert Loggia, David Keith and David Caruso.

Steven Spielberg's Second World War drama based on JG Ballard's semi-autobiographical novel, starring Christian Bale, John Malkovich and Nigel Havers.

programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton \u0026 Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Following a gig, fading music star Jackson Maine happens upon Ally, a nightclub singer-songwriter. Their instant chemistry leads to a tempestuous romance as he helps her on the road to stardom. However, Jackson's alcoholism has explosive repercussions as her career blossoms. Oscar-winning drama, starring Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper, who also directed, and Sam Elliott.

programme.title: Nuremberg
programme.desc: A US Army psychiatrist is sent to assess high-ranking Nazi prisoners - most notably Hermann Göring - to decide if they're fit for trial. As the Nuremberg trials begin, he becomes enmeshed in a psychological and legal battle. Director James Vanderbilt's thriller, starring Russell Crowe, Rami Malek and Leo Woodall.

programme.title: I, Tonya
programme.desc: Ice skater Tonya Harding rises through the ranks at the US figure skating championships, but her future in the sport is thrown into question by a shocking incident after her ex-husband steps in. Director Craig Gillespie's comedy biopic, starring Margot Robbie, Sebastian Stan, and Allison Janney, who won a Bafta and an Oscar for her performance.

programme.title: American Sniper
programme.desc: A Navy Seal becomes a legend to his colleagues thanks to his skills as a deadly sniper. On his return to the US following four tours of duty in Iraq, he finds living an ordinary life as a husband and father far more difficult to deal with than the demands of warfare. Biopic based on the experiences of real-life Iraq conflict veteran Chris Kyle, directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper, Sienna Miller and Kyle Gallner.

programme.title: Burning an Illusion
programme.desc: A black woman living in West London hopes to marry her boyfriend, but finds her life thrown into upheaval when he loses his job and is subsequently arrested after getting into a fight. The experience makes her reassess her priorities, and she decides to reconnect with her African heritage. Drama, starring Cassie McFarlane and Victor Romero Evans.

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: An oil-rigger who has cut himself off from his cultured, middle-class roots reluctantly returns to his family home, with his pregnant girlfriend in tow, after receiving word that his father is dying. However, the homecoming turns into a failure, as the psychological journey has a lasting impact on himself and those closest to him. Drama, with Jack Nicholson, Karen Black, Susan Anspach and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: Love Story
programme.desc: Two students at Harvard University fall in love, but their romance is fated to be cut tragically short by the discovery that one of them has a terminal illness. Romantic drama, starring Ali MacGraw, Ryan O'Neal and Ray Milland.(n)

programme.title: Let's Dance
programme.desc: A singing and dancing war widow tries to shield her son from her husband's interfering wealthy parents by absconding to New York, where she is reunited with her former showbiz partner. They resurrect their old dance act, while her in-laws begin a campaign to claim custody of their grandchild. Musical, starring Fred Astaire, Betty Hutton, Roland Young and Ruth Warrick.(n)

programme.title: The Boy in the Striped Pyjamas
programme.desc: Bruno, a boy in Nazi Germany, moves to the country when his father is placed in charge of a concentration camp. While exploring the woods close to the facility's boundary, he spots a Jewish youngster being held there, and the two become friends - but Bruno remains innocently oblivious to the camp's true purpose. Drama, starring David Thewlis, Asa Butterfield and Jack Scanlon.(n)

programme.title: I, Tonya
programme.desc: Ice skater Tonya Harding rises through the ranks at the US figure skating championships, but her future in the sport is thrown into question by a shocking incident after her ex-husband steps in. Director Craig Gillespie's comedy biopic, starring Margot Robbie, Sebastian Stan, and Allison Janney, who won a Bafta and an Oscar for her performance.(n)

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: A depressed fortysomething woman about to get divorced faints at a high-school reunion and awakes to find she has travelled back in time to her teenage years. Given the chance to put things right, she resolves to avoid a relationship with the man she is about to divorce. Comedy, starring Kathleen Turner, Nicolas Cage, Maureen O'Sullivan, Joan Allen, Catherine Hicks and Kevin J O'Connor.(n)

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: A woman supports her daughter despite their differences over three tumultuous decades. The indomitable matriarch disapproves of her daughter's marriage and finds grandmotherhood hard to get used to, but is fiercely protective of her family when tragedy strikes. Oscar-winning drama, starring Shirley MacLaine, Debra Winger, Jack Nicholson, Danny DeVito and Jeff Daniels.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Victory
programme.desc: Allied PoWs take to the football field when a group of Nazi officers comes up with the idea to have them take on a German team for a propaganda event. However, the prisoners see a chance to escape during the match. Second World War adventure, with Michael Caine, Sylvester Stallone, Max von Sydow and Daniel Massey. Soccer legends also making appearances include Pele, Bobby Moore and Ossie Ardiles.(n)

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: When a couple flee Europe in 1947, their new lives in the US are changed by a strange client. Director Brady Corbet's drama, starring Adrien Brody, Felicity Jones, Guy Pearce and Joe Alwyn.(n)

programme.title: Cool Hand Luke
programme.desc: A rebellious small-time crook is sent to a prison in the Deep South, where he becomes a hero in the eyes of his fellow convicts and a thorn in the sides of the warden and the guards by refusing to bow to authority. His defiance escalates when he receives news of his mother's death, and embarks on a series of failed escape attempts. Drama based on Donn Pearce's novel, starring Paul Newman, George Kennedy, JD Cannon and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: A woman supports her daughter despite their differences over three tumultuous decades. The indomitable matriarch disapproves of her daughter's marriage and finds grandmotherhood hard to get used to, but is fiercely protective of her family when tragedy strikes. Oscar-winning drama, starring Shirley MacLaine, Debra Winger, Jack Nicholson, Danny DeVito and Jeff Daniels.(n)

programme.title: King Ivory
programme.desc: Tulsa narcotics cop Layne West is locked in a battle with the city's criminal underworld. When his son becomes addicted to fentanyl, West teams up with his partner Ty and FBI agent Beatty to bring down those responsible. Thriller, starring James Badge Dale and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: One More Shot
programme.desc: On New Year's Eve 1999, a young woman discovers a bottle of time-travelling tequila, and each shot takes her back to the start of the night. Comedy, starring Emily Browning, Aisha Dee and Sean Keenan.(n)

programme.title: Plainclothes
programme.desc: An undercover agent assigned to lure and arrest gay men defies orders when he falls for a target. Writer/director Carmen Emmi's thriller, starring Tom Blyth, Russell Tovey and Maria Dizzia.(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World: Rebirth
programme.desc: Profit-hungry pharmaceutical representative Martin Krebs contracts covert operations specialist Zora Bennett to assemble a crack team to infiltrate a forbidden island and collect the DNA of three key dinosaur species. Fantasy adventure, starring Scarlett Johansson, Mahershala Ali and Jonathan Bailey.(n)

programme.title: I Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: A group of friends are terrorised by a stalker who knows about a gruesome secret from their past. Horror reboot, starring Madelyn Cline and Chase Sui Wonders.(n)

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon
programme.desc: On the isle of Berk, where Vikings and dragons have been enemies for generations, young warrior Hiccup breaks tradition by forming an unlikely bond with Toothless, a feared Night Fury. Live action fantasy adventure, starring Mason Thames, Nico Parker and Gerard Butler.(n)

programme.title: Bring Her Back
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Andy and his visually impaired younger stepsister Piper discover their father dead in the shower. Single mother Laura agrees to take in Andy and Piper until the traumatised youngster comes of age and can apply for legal guardianship of his stepsister. Hoever, when events inside Laura's home spiral out of control, Andy fears he is losing his mind. Thriller, starring Billy Barratt, Sora Wong and Sally Hawkins.(n)

programme.title: M3GAN 2.0
programme.desc: Two years following M3GAN's rampage, her creator, Gemma, resorts to resurrecting her infamous creation in order to take down Amelia, the military-grade weapon built by a defense contractor who stole M3GAN's underlying tech, which has turned on its creators. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Violet McGraw, Jemaine Clement and Allison Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Cinema List: Brit Hit
programme.desc: Celebrating the best of British. Featuring classics like Snatch and Bridget Jones. Expect iconic performances and a uniquely British blend of humour and heart.(n)

programme.title: Pets on a Train
programme.desc: When a gang of animal crooks set out on what should be a simple con, they're swept into a train robbery. It falls to Falcon, a small-time raccoon thief, and Rex, a by-the-book police dog, to put their differences aside and protect the passengers aboard a runaway high-speed train. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Wyatt Bowen and Daniel Brochu.(n)

Pet Sematary
programme.desc: When a young boy dies in an accident, his father buries him in a cemetery with the power to resurrect its inhabitants. Stephen King adaptation. Strong language/violence.

programme.title: The Lost Boys
programme.desc: In a town troubled by bloodsuckers, Corey Haim's brother starts behaving like a vamp, so he sets out to take down Kiefer Sutherland. Flashing images.

programme.title: Wolf Man
programme.desc: A family is attacked by an unseen animal, but as the night stretches on, the father begins to transform into something unrecognizable.

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: Vin Diesel stars in this high tension action sci-fi as a murderous convict who becomes the last hope for the survivors of an intergalactic crash.

programme.title: The Crazies
programme.desc: A virus turns the residents of a small town into murderous maniacs. Horror with Timothy Olyphant. Language/violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Until Dawn
programme.desc: After her sister disappeared, Clover and her friends head to where she vanished to search for answers. They soon encounter a masked killer who murders them one by one.

programme.title: Speak No Evil
programme.desc: A dream holiday turns into a nightmare when an American family stay at a British couple's idyllic estate. Horror with James McAvoy.

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: Thief Janet Leigh makes a mistake when she checks into Anthony Perkins' secluded motel. Alfred Hitchcock directs this groundbreaking thriller. Violence.

programme.title: Sinners
programme.desc: Trying to leave their troubled lives behind, two brothers return to their hometown, realising that an even greater evil is waiting for them.

programme.title: IT
programme.desc: Hit adaptation of the Stephen King novel about a ragtag bunch of bullied outsiders battling evil, sewer-dwelling clown Pennywise. Jaeden Lieberher stars.

programme.title: The Shining
programme.desc: Caretaking a remote hotel, writer Jack Nicholson slowly succumbs to murderous insanity. Stanley Kubrick directs this unsettling horror classic. Contains violent scenes.

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: William Friedkin's Oscar-winning horror about a priest battling to save the soul of a girl. Language/violence/mature themes/sex/flashing images.

programme.title: Heart Eyes
programme.desc: This Valentine's Day, no couple is safe as the 'Heart Eyes Killer' returns to wreak havoc by stalking and murdering romantic couples. Romantic slasher.

programme.title: From Dusk Till Dawn
programme.desc: Thief George Clooney finds himself besieged by vampires in a desert saloon. Contains strong language, violence, sex, mature scenes and flashing images.

programme.title: The Radleys
programme.desc: The Radleys are a normal family, but have a dark secret - they are abstaining vampires with bloodthirsty instincts. Sky Original film with Damian Lewis and Kelly Macdonald.

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: Black photographer Daniel Kaluuya is anxious about meeting his white girlfriend's parents... and rightly so. Horror directed by Jordan Peele.

programme.title: Salem's Lot
programme.desc: Based on Stephen King's terrifying novel, this horror sees an author stumble upon a town under the threat of a bloodthirsty vampire.

A musician calls them in to investigate when she sees strange creatures in her kitchen, only to end up possessed. As the spook-hunting team members deal with an attempt to shut their operation down, they discover an evil demonic entity is

programme.title: Ghostbusters II
programme.desc: The eccentric spectre-hunters reunite to save New York from a massive river of slime generated by the citizens' negativity and nasty thoughts. Meanwhile, the spirit of a 16th-century tyrant tries to return to the land of the living by possessing the body of a toddler. Sequel to the supernatural comedy, starring Bill Murray, Sigourney Weaver, Dan Aykroyd, Harold Ramis, Rick Moranis and Ernie Hudson

programme.title: The Amazing Maurice
programme.desc: A streetwise cat has the perfect money-making scam after finding a pipe-playing kid who has a horde of strangely literate rats. Animated adventure based on the Terry Pratchett story, featuring the voices of Hugh Laurie, Emilia Clarke and David Thewlis.

programme.title: Super Charlie
programme.desc: Willie's dream of fighting crime with his cop dad is shattered when his baby brother Charlie arrives. And the new family member turns out to have superpowers. Family animation, with the voices of Karen Ardiff and Alex Kelly.

programme.title: Dog Man
programme.desc: A half-human canine is sworn to protect and serve as he faces feline supervillain Petey the Cat. Animated comedy, with the voices of Pete Davidson, Poppy Liu, Lil Rel Howery and Isla Fisher.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The tiny blue forest-dwelling creatures flee from an evil wizard, only to end up magically transported to modern-day New York. They search for a way to get back to their own village while evading their enemy, who has followed them to the Big Apple. Fantasy comedy, with Neil Patrick Harris, Hank Azaria and Jayma Mays, plus voices of Jonathan Winters and Katy Perry.

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon
programme.desc: On the isle of Berk, where Vikings and dragons have been enemies for generations, young warrior Hiccup breaks tradition by forming an unlikely bond with Toothless, a feared Night Fury. Live action fantasy adventure, starring Mason Thames, Nico Parker and Gerard Butler.

programme.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
programme.desc: An incompetent scientist finally invents something that works - a machine that turns water into food. When the device gets launched into the atmosphere, it has a strange effect on his town's weather, causing giant meals to fall from the sky to the delight of the residents - until it gets out of control. Animated comedy, with the voices of Bill Hader, Anna Faris and James Caan.

programme.title: Dog Man
programme.desc: A half-human canine is sworn to protect and serve as he faces feline supervillain Petey the Cat. Animated comedy, with the voices of Pete Davidson, Poppy Liu, Lil Rel Howery and Isla Fisher.

programme.title: Stardust
programme.desc: A young shop assistant in Victorian England enters a magical parallel world in search of a fallen star to give to the girl of his dreams. programme.desc: The truth about Egg's identity is revealed as Dunk invites danger by doing the right thing and preparing for the tournament.

programme.title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
programme.desc: Dunk angers the Targaryens and demands trial by combat; when Aerion calls for a trial of seven, Dunk must find six knights to join him in battle.

programme.title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
programme.desc: Dunk and his six knights face off against Aerion's forces in the trial of seven; Aerion knocks Dunk off his horse; Dunk sees flashbacks of his childhood on Flea Bottom.

programme.title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
programme.desc: The people of Ashford mourn a significant loss following the tournament; Dunk reflects on his future and evaluates his responsibilities toward Egg; he decides whether to keep the boy as his squire.

programme.title: Sinners
programme.desc: Trying to leave their troubled lives behind, twin brothers return to their Mississippi hometown to start again, only to discover that an even greater evil is waiting to welcome them back.

programme.title: Chris Fleming: Live at the Palace
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Fleming bursts onto the screen with a fun and lighthearted blend of skillful storytelling and wild physicality in his first HBO stand-up special. A high-energy performer who seamlessly pivots from one everyday topic to another - from Trader Joe's to Oreos, NPR, and dog breeds - Fleming bounds across the stage as he shares his unique takes on masculinity, conga lines, and more.

programme.title: Neighbors
programme.desc: In Florida, former friends Melissa and Victoria dispute the rightful ownership of a small patch of grass between their West Palm Beach homes; in Palm Bay, Johnny and Andy's own grass-related feud leads to accusations of stalking.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A grief-stricken widow stops by a remote cabin after getting lost on the back roads of Minnesota in the middle of winter. She soon finds herself in a desperate fight for survival as she encounters a murderous couple holding a young woman hostage.

programme.title: The Town
programme.desc: Doug MacRay leads a band of ruthless bank robbers and has no real attachments except for James, who -- despite his dangerous temper -- is like a brother. Everything changes for Doug when James briefly takes a hostage, bank employee Claire Keesey. programme.title: The Spectacular Now
programme.desc: High school senior Sutter Keely is an effortless charmer and self-proclaimed life of the party who unexpectedly falls in love with the nice girl Aimee Fineky. programme.title: Dune: Part Two

programme.title: Industry
programme.desc: Young graduates compete for permanent positions at a top investment bank in London, but the boundaries between colleague, friend, lover and enemy soon blur as they immerse themselves in their new world.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: "Spider-Man" centers on student Peter Parker (Tobey Maguire) who, after being bitten by a genetically-altered spider, gains superhuman strength and the spider-like ability to cling to any surface. He vows to use his abilities to fight crime, coming to understand the words of his beloved Uncle Ben: "With great power comes great responsibility.".

programme.title: Spider-Man 2
programme.desc: When a failed nuclear fusion experiment results in an explosion that kills his wife, Dr. Otto Octavius is transformed into Dr. Octopus, a cyborg with deadly metal tentacles. programme.desc: Justices (Frank Langella, Danny Glover) of the Supreme Court discuss boxer Muhammad Ali's refusal to fight in the Vietnam War.

programme.title: Magic Mike's Last Dance

Hoping for one last hurrah, Mike heads to London with a wealthy socialite who lures him with an offer he can't refuse -- and an agenda all her own. With everything on the line, he soon finds himself trying to whip a hot new roster of talented dancers into shape.

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: Danger once again surrounds Bella, as a string of mysterious killings terrorizes Seattle and a malicious vampire continues her infernal quest for revenge.
